name: DPR 010 // Heathers - Teenage Clothes 7"
description:
Debut 7" by Los Angeles guitar-slangin' indiepop up-and-comers Heathers. 

A. Teenage Clothes
B. I Don't Wanna Be Adored

Heathers is Michael Francis and Thom Lucero

All mail order copies come on lush oxblood vinyl while supplies last. Stream the whole shebang below:

name: Ides - Songs About Love/Hate (distro only)
description: Ides is the solo project of the incomparable (and darling friend of mine) Lan Gruesome, who also happens to be the lead singer of the excellent Cardiff/Brighton/London pop band Joanna Gruesome (as well as the former bass player for essential popsters Evans the Death). Anyway, that all hardly matters because Ides stands in a class of her own and I'm super excited to be able to distribute a few copies of her four-song cassette (originally out on UK label Reeks of Effort) in the US. "Sounds like someone replaced her Cheerios with valium." - someone (??) Four gloomy gorgeous heartaching songs for those gloaming lonely summer nights a bottle and a half of cheap merlot and two packs of Luckies deep on limited edition cassette. Though there are echoes of early Cat Power and other sad-eyed lowland ladies, these four songs begin with a whisper and build into a bang; the result is a positively affecting and moving EP of longing, regret, resilience, resolve, and, of course, the janus-faced hydra of love and hate. We'll only have 8 2 copies left in stock, so get one now before they are gone FOREVER. And because this is such a special thing, fuck it, free shipping! Listen to the whole caboodle below and to purchase it digitally, head on over to Reeks of Effort. >>> This is a domestic US distribution only. Sincerest apologies to international fans! <<<

name: DPR 005 // The Birthday Kiss - Can You Keep A Secret? 7"
description: Double A side debut single by Leeds/London band The Birthday Kiss! Two gorgeous songs that wiggle around in your head and cut straight to the heart. Preorder starts March 25th, records will ship on or before April 8th This 7" is now available! Limited to 250 copies, first 50 on blue transparent/haze fancy schmancy vinyl! Heyo! Color vinyl has sold out. Sorry! The Birthday Kiss were formed in 2012 by instrumentalist and songwriter Ben Siddall (ex-The Lodger) and singer Sarah Williams (ex-The Research), separated by the M1 via Leeds and London. Since then the band have recorded a handful of songs, including a Christmas song “Sentimental Christmastime” which was played a number of times on Gideon Coe's BBC 6music programme. This is their debut single. The band are currently working on their debut album. Ben has also produced tracks for other Leeds bands such as This Many Boyfriends, Post War Glamour Girls and Just Handshakes (We're British) in his basement studio in Leeds. Stream the 7" below! check out the video for the a-side! Attention: this is the sole physical release by The Birthday Kiss, as they announced their break-up recently. To commemorate their brief but brilliant career, we're offering this 7" for a mere $5. Why not get your sweetheart something to swoon over? Grab one before they're gone forever!

name: DPR 006 // Nothing to Lose, vol. 1: Surf Club/Manatee
description:
Welcome to our brand new split singles series, Nothing to Lose! For the first installment we paired up two exquisite Bay Area bands: Stockton's Surf Club (who released their debut EP with us in May last year) and Oakland's mysterious Manatee, who have put out a 7" and a flexi with the legendary Slumberland (it is simply coincidence, we swear, that Papa Slumber himself plays guitar for the quartet). 

Surf Club quickly follow up the release of their newest digital single "Heaven" with an even dreamier pop cut, "Swoon." If you don't swoon to these young heartaches then I don't know what's wrong with you! 

Manatee round out the b-side with two choice cut. The instrumental "Theme (Dugong Sing-Along)" will certainly get your heart pumping while their bombastic cover of the legendary Big Boys' "Which Way To Go" will literally draw blood. Literally. 

This is a SUPER limited edition split 7" and these three songs will never be available anywhere else EVER! To celebrate our inaugural volume of Nothing to Lose, ALL 7"s will be on gorgeous arctic white vinyl and will come with an assortment of goodies like free badges and hand drawn comics! Or something! We don't know yet! Nothing to Lose, y'all! 

All hail the rabbit with wings!

Stream the entire 7" below!

<iframe width="100%" height="450" scrolling="no" frameborder="no" src="https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F3708285"></iframe>

categories.name: Nothing to Lose split single series

name: DPR 001 // Surf Club - Young Love EP
description:
Hey, it's our first ever official release!!!!
-------
Emanating the sunshine-y vibe in the midst of landlocked Stockton, Surf Club is the brianchild of Frankie Soto, an early member of pre-label Craft Spells. More polished than the prior project, and with the addition of Eddie Zepeda, Alfonso Robles, and Jose Medina; the band has no hints of being inlanders with their jangly guitars and swoon-worthy vocals. Quickly collecting a fan base by playing shows in the Bay Area with like-minded musicians, Surf Club gains comparisons to all the cliches – but they break molds with an infectious stand-out creativity. Their debut release, Young Love, is a 4-song EP full of infectious washes of fuzzed-out, sweetheart pop at its finest. Ltd. to 300 copies on 10" vinyl (first 100 on gorgeous white opaque vinyl). 

Jackets are silk screened by Golden Rule Design in Portland. 

Please note: We have SOLD OUT of color vinyl.

name: DPR 002 // Prescription Pills - White Rose 7"
description:
BEAUTIFUL REMORSEFUL 3-SONG FUNERAL POP 7" FROM PORTLAND'S OWN GOTHIC GENIUS AND WAMPIRE BASSIST COLE BROWNING. 

FIRST 100 ON ROSEPINK VINYL. 

FLOWERS B/W REGRETS & WINGED VICTORY

PREORDER BEGINS 7/10, COMES OUT 7/31

name: DPR 003 // WL - Impermanent 7"
description: IMPERMANENT B/W NO ESCAPE DEBUT RELEASE BY WL FEAT. MEMBERS OF HOUNDSTOOTH AND BLOUSE. SOME OF THE BEST SHOEGAZE DROWNED IN A SEA FLOWERS YOU'LL HEAR SINCE 1991 CAME AND LEFT ITS ENTRAILS ON OUR DOORSTEPS. FIRST 100 ON GORGEOUS DROWNING TEAL. Color vinyl is sold out. We have sold out of copies of this 7". The band still has copies left, so make sure to catch one of their shows! Stream the a-side below:

name: DPR 004 // YUNG LIFE - YUNG LIFE LP
description:
YUNG LIFE – YUNG LIFE (DPR-004) 

S/T LP (their first on vinyl!) FROM KNOXVILLE POP JAMMERS. ALREADY SEEN RELEASE DIGITALLY, ON CASSETTE, AND ON CD, BUT NOW DEATH PARTY BRINGS YOU THE SPECTACULAR HIT-FILLED ALBUM ON VAINGLORIOUS VINYL. YUNG LIFE BRING PURE POP PERFECTION, DANCEY RHYTHMS, AND HOOK LINE & SINKER MELODIES TO THEIR PRIVATE PARTY. LIMITED TO 500 COPIES, FIRST 100 ON WICKED ROYAL BLUE/MAGENTA VINYL. AND HEY, THIS IS ALSO DEATH PARTY’S FIRST LP! HOORAY! 

All mailorder on gorgeous magenta/royal blue opaque/haze colored vinyl and will come with a free Yung Life badge! (while supplies last o'course).

Stream the opening track "Isn't This" below!
